title: Aryaman Birla
text:
Aryaman Birla (born 9 July 1997) is an Indian <a href="cricket">cricket</a>er.
Early life and background.
He is son of <a href="Kumar%20Mangalam%20Birla">Kumar Mangalam Birla</a>, a billionaire-industrialist and the chairman of the <a href="Aditya%20Birla%20Group">Aditya Birla Group</a> and a member of the <a href="Birla%20family">Birla family</a>. In 2018, he was pursuing a <a href="commerce">commerce</a> degree through distance learning from the <a href="University%20of%20Mumbai">University of Mumbai</a>.
Career.
He made his <a href="first-class%20cricket">first-class</a> debut for <a href="Madhya%20Pradesh%20cricket%20team">Madhya Pradesh</a> in the <a href="2017%E2%80%9318%20Ranji%20Trophy">2017–18 Ranji Trophy</a> on 25 November 2017. In January 2018, he was bought by the <a href="Rajasthan%20Royals">Rajasthan Royals</a> in the <a href="List%20of%202018%20Indian%20Premier%20League%20personnel%20changes">2018 IPL auction</a>. In November 2018, he scored his maiden century in first-class cricket. In 2019, he took a <a href="sabbatical">sabbatical</a> from cricket owing to <a href="Mental%20disorder">mental health problems</a>. He was released by the Rajasthan Royals ahead of the <a href="List%20of%202020%20Indian%20Premier%20League%20personnel%20changes">2020 IPL auction</a>.
